title: 17. Dynamic Programming, Part 3: APSP, Parens, Piano
description:
MIT 6.006 Introduction to Algorithms, Spring 2020
Instructor: Erik Demaine
View the complete course: https://ocw.mit.edu/6-006S20
YouTube Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLUl4u3cNGP63EdVPNLG3ToM6LaEUuStEY

This is the third of four lectures on dynamic programming. This focusses on applying subproblem constraints and expansions to example problems including, Bellman-Ford SSSP, Floyd-Warshall APSP, arithmetic parenthesization, and piano/guitar fingering.

tags: Floyd-Warshall, all pairs shortest path, arithmetic parenthesization, piano fingering, DAG
